titleStmt.title: Right re-entred and the reasons thereof rendered in the plain, yet modest, apology of Zach. Crofton, minister of the Gospel at Buttolphs Aldgate, London for his return to the exercise of his own ministry in his own church at the usual hours of publick worship on the Lords daies afternoon, in which hee hath been for a season obstructed by Mr. John Sympson.
titleStmt.author: Crofton, Zachary, 1625 or 6-1672.

titleStmt.title: Right re-entred and the reasons thereof rendered in the plain, yet modest, apology of Zach. Crofton, minister of the Gospel at Buttolphs Aldgate, London for his return to the exercise of his own ministry in his own church at the usual hours of publick worship on the Lords daies afternoon, in which hee hath been for a season obstructed by Mr. John Sympson.
titleStmt.author: Crofton, Zachary, 1625 or 6-1672.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
